p: In 2006–2010, amongst HIV diagnoses attributed to heterosexual sex, the highest proportion were among Australian-born men and women, followed by those born in Sub-Saharan Africa, South-East Asia, North-West Europe, Oceania, North Africa and Middle East, Southern and Central Asia, Southern and Eastern Europe, the Americas and North-East Asia. In 2011–15, the highest proportion were among Australian-born men and women, followed by those born in Sub-Saharan Africa, South-East Asia, Oceania, North-West Europe, North Africa and Middle East, Southern and Central Asia, North-East Asia, Southern and Eastern Europe and the Americas.
